title: Art Show Reception
logline: Jason’s art reception turns into a public circus when Catherine announces a $50,000 challenge to steal his painting, causing Jason’s anxiety to spike as he learns the scheme may echo an art scam from New York.

setting.environment: Crowded, lively art opening with snacks, chatter, and Jason’s paintings hung throughout the space.

JASON_TOWNE.objective: Maintain composure at his reception; understand Franklin’s game; protect his artwork.

STACEY.objective: Capture Jason’s reactions and the events of the reception.

CATHERINE.objective: Announce Franklin’s planned challenge to the art show audience.

DAVID_GILL.objective: Engage Jason intellectually; introduce his peculiar humor.

MARY_RIOS.objective: Warn Jason about a similar scam she’s heard of.

story_beats.description: Jason arrives at his packed art show, anxious about the impending theft announcement.
Jason meets David Gill at the snack table, sharing a humorous exchange about charcuterie.
Catherine interrupts the room with the announcement: $50,000 to anyone who steals Jason’s painting.
Guests rush to grab Catherine’s cards, escalating the chaotic atmosphere.
Mary Rios approaches Jason, warning him of a similar staged-theft scam her friend experienced.
Catherine announces a guard will be posted, making the challenge seem more theatrical and absurd.
Jason panics and exits abruptly, requesting Mary text him the contact info.

dialogue.line: What do you think charcuterie means?
Um, piles of fatty meats and cheeses with sprinkles of fruit.
..Well no, it means platter of assorted appetizers.
Hello everyone... One of you will be fifty thousand dollars richer soon.
If any of you can steal this painting, we will pay you fifty thousand dollars in cash once you’ve stolen it without getting caught.
I’ve heard this before. My friend in New York went through something like this. It was all a scam.
I can’t believe this… That fucking prick.
A guard will be posted at the show. We can’t make stealing this painting too easy.
I’ve got to get out of here… Will you text me Randal’s info?

setup_payoffs.dummy_phone: Sets up trust/deception motifs; Jason’s paranoia increases.
setup_payoffs.Franklin's announcement: This scene executes the theft challenge setup.
setup_payoffs.Mary’s warning: Foreshadows a larger con or reveal later in the story.
